title: Intelligent Opening Selection Algorithm for Browse Screen
description:
Add intelligent opening selection algorithm to OpeningBrowserScreen that prioritizes openings based on learning progress.

## Feature Requirements

**Display:**
- Location: OpeningBrowserScreen (Browse tab)
- Layout: 10 prioritized openings at top ("Recommended for You"), full browsable list below
- Visual distinction: Recommended section prominently displayed

**Selection Algorithm:**
- Weighted random selection with frequency weights
- Hard-rated: 3x weight (appear most frequently)
- Medium/Good-rated: 1x weight (normal frequency)
- Easy-rated: 0.3x weight (learned = less frequent)
- Unrated openings: 1x weight (treat as medium priority)

**Learning Logic:**
- Opening rated "easy" = learned, should appear less frequently
- Opening rated "hard" = needs practice, should appear more frequently
- As user improves and ratings change, selection automatically adapts

## Technical Implementation

**Architecture:**
- Enhance existing OpeningRoulette service
- Add selectTopOpenings(count, allOpenings, progress) method
- Reuse existing weight calculation logic for consistency

**Files to Modify:**
1. src/services/gamification/openingRoulette.ts
   - Add selectTopOpenings() method with weighted random selection
   
2. src/screens/OpeningBrowserScreen.tsx
   - Add "Recommended for You" section at top
   - Integrate with OpeningRoulette.selectTopOpenings()
   - Add pull-to-refresh functionality
   - Display top 10 prominently, full list below

## Success Criteria

- Top 10 openings displayed prominently on Browse screen
- Hard-rated openings appear ~3x more than medium
- Easy-rated openings appear ~0.3x as frequently
- Selection uses weighted random algorithm (variety + intelligence)
- List refreshes on pull-to-refresh
- Full opening list still accessible below recommendations
- No performance issues

## Edge Cases

- All openings same rating: still provide variety
- Fewer than 10 openings: show all available
- No progress data: treat all as medium priority
- Rapid refreshes: consider debouncing

## Priority Justification

P0 (Critical) - This feature is essential for improving learning outcomes by surfacing the right content at the right time. Helps users focus on openings they need to practice most while maintaining engagement through intelligent variety.
